posts.post_content: While it has been a faithful companion, your Companion Cube cannot accompany you through the rest of the test. If it could talk - and the Enrichment Center takes this opportunity to remind you that it cannot - it would tell you to go on without it, because it would rather die in a fire than become a burden to you.

posts.post_content:
Card of the Day, December 19th, 2012  
Mana Vault, it comes into play untapped and gives you three mana turn one. With a [Voltaic Key](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voltaic Key) it's a essentially a [Black Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Lotus) every turn except for 2 colorless mana. In that sense, I guess it's a lot like [Sol Ring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sol Ring), except for the first turn.  
For those of you who play MTGO, you get to play this in Cube Draft soon. And with fancy new art that's less like this Companion Cube, and more like an epic vault of mystery.

posts.post_content: This card is a dark ritual that can interact with artifact effects ([Tinker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tinker)) and the mana can be used on any turn after you cast it. PLUS it can be untapped for later use by paying 4 mana or through more interaction ([Voltaic Key](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voltaic Key)). I think you all know how good dark ritual is. This thing is dark ritual on steroids in the right deck, trust me.

Turn one: play land, mana vault, 1st voltaic key, untap and reuse mana vault, play 1st Thran dynamo, play 2nd voltaic key, untap and reuse dynamo or vault, play 2nd Dynamo, play 3rd voltaic key, untap Mana Vault. Posted By: Wizard-of-the-Toast (4/19/2011 4:00:23 AM)

posts.post_content:
Time to make the spikes cringe!  
How about some casual uses for those of us not intent on abusing fun but powerful artifacts?  
[Braid of fire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Braid of fire) is not a bad way to get repeat value out of both cards. For a cost of ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol), you can transfer ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol) from your upkeep to your main phase.   
It also forms a nice two card combo with [soulbright flamekin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=soulbright flamekin).  
Turn 1: land, mana vault  
Turn 2: land, Soulbright  
Turn 3: land, something that can use ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)  
Playing this without a means to untap it is not worth it if you are planning on games going 10+ turns.   
And now to go for broke: use black lotus to power out a [Celestial Prism](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Celestial Prism) on the first turn!

Posted By: kiseki (7/28/2011 4:32:02 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
You guys wouldn't believe this now, but this card was unrestricted for years. Sol Ring was limited to 1-per-deck almost since the beginning, but it took until 1999, if I remember right, until they finally restricted Mana Vault. Notice it was printed all the way through 5th edition...!  
  
Although I often ran 4 Dark Rituals in many decks, I never put in more than 1 Mana Vault because it seemed just plain cruel to do so. The first time I used a Mana Vault, it was in a mono-red deck; I summoned a Shivan Dragon with it on the 3rd turn and just sat there, staring at my cards on the table in disbelief. I couldn't believe a card this powerful was being allowed FOUR PER DECK. Compared to Dark Ritual, Mana Vault provides the same amount of mana, without the color commitment, is reusable, and can even be cast on one turn and have all 3 mana used another turn. The 1 damage upkeep is a nearly insignificant tradeoff, compared to, say, the massive pain you can suffer from a 1st turn [Mana Cry](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mana Cry)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Why is this card banned in legacy, yet [Grim Monolith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grim Monolith) isn't? It isn't even close to as easy to get infinite mana out of a Mana Vault. Is the one extra colorless to play really that balancing, for a card that only needs one companion to ascend?  
  
For those comparing it to a [Sol Ring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sol Ring) when used in conjunction with a Voltaic Key, you are missing the muscle. It begins untapped. It can be tapped for three, play the Voltaic Key, leaving two floating, and then untapped with the Key, then tapped again for a net of 4 colorless, which usually means [Su-Chi](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Su-Chi) or [Isochron Scepter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Isochron Scepter) and first use. Or just go mana crazy on turn three...  
  
1. Swamp, Mana Vault, Voltaic key, Su-Chi  
2. Swamp, Sol Ring, Swing for 4 with Su-Chi  
3. Swing for 4 with Su-Chi, Tap Swamp, Sac for [Lake of the Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lake of the Dead). Tap swamp, Tap Lake, 6 floating black. [Sacrifice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sacrifice) Su-Chi. 10 floating black, 4 floating colorless... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Why is this card banned in legacy, yet Grim Monolith isn't? It isn't even close to as easy to get infinite mana out of a Mana Vault. Is the one extra colorless to play really that balancing, for a card that only needs one companion to ascend?

For those comparing it to a Sol Ring when used in conjunction with a Voltaic Key, you are missing the muscle. It begins untapped. It can be tapped for three, play the Voltaic Key, leaving two floating, and then untapped with the Key, then tapped again for a net of 4 colorless, which usually means Su-Chi or Isochron Scepter and first use. Or just go mana crazy on turn three...

1. Swamp, Mana Vault, Voltaic key, Su-Chi
2. Swamp, Sol Ring, Swing for 4 with Su-Chi
3. Swing for 4 with Su-Chi, Tap Swamp, Sac for Lake of the Dead. Tap swamp, Tap Lake, 6 floating black. Sacrifice Su-Chi. 10 floating black, 4 floating colorless... (see all)

posts.post_content:
Legal, and enjoyable, in Commander.  
  
In Vintage, it turns [Wasteland](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wasteland) into a turn-one [Mishra's Workshop](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mishra's Workshop) and/or powers out a [Metalworker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Metalworker). I never liked it as much for Storm, but it seems compatible with [Ad Nauseam](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ad Nauseam).  
  
It's *hilarious* to see people suggesting this and Sol Ring would be acceptably nonbroken in Legacy. Please, please, please convince Wizards to unban them! Then Metalworker, [Trinisphere](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Trinisphere), [Wasteland](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wasteland), [Lodestone Golem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lodestone Golem) and I will see you in the very next tournament... good luck ever casting a spell. I've played three-game matches where my opponent never had a chance to play a nonland card. :)
posts.html:
Legal, and enjoyable, in Commander.

In Vintage, it turns Wasteland into a turn-one Mishra's Workshop and/or powers out a Metalworker. I never liked it as much for Storm, but it seems compatible with Ad Nauseam.

It's hilarious to see people suggesting this and Sol Ring would be acceptably nonbroken in Legacy. Please, please, please convince Wizards to unban them! Then Metalworker, Trinisphere, Wasteland, Lodestone Golem and I will see you in the very next tournament... good luck ever casting a spell. I've played three-game matches where my opponent never had a chance to play a nonland card. :)
